etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in John Weaver (1673–1760), dancer and choreographer. From French sissone, (now usually) sissonne (although this is apparently first attested slightly later than in English: 1710 or earlier; 1686 in the fuller form pas de sissonne) from the name of François César de Roussy, comte de Sissonne, to whom the invention of this ballet step is attributed

definitions: A jump into the air from which a dancer lands on one foot with the other leg extended to the back, front, or side.
